title: Why do people do this?
body:
So, it's mid-game.

Both teams are pretty Steven, so it's more a battle of wits now.

First bottom turrets are down, enemy Mid turret is down, and our Top turret has fallen.

We see their bot lane - two Champions - have gone bot to clear a substantial wave that has reached the second turret.
We see their mid laner is middle, doing much the same.
We don't have eyes on their top or jungle.

As a three-man squad we go to get their top turret. We have ADC, Support and Top, so it'll fall quickly.

We get to the turret, we are banging on it.

Mid disappears, still no eyes on top or jungle. At this point, we must assume they're coming for us.

We get the turret.

**Now, this is where my confusion begins.
**

WHY DO PEOPLE STAY AFTER THE TURRET? I DON'T KNOW! EXTRA WAVE OR SOMETHING? IF YOU'RE NOT GETTING THE SECOND ONE, JUST BACK AWAY, EVALUATE AND EXECUTE A PLAN.

Why do they stay in these random, high-risk situations?
THIS GOES FOR STAYING OR TRYING TO FIGHT IN OTHER PARTS OF THE MAP WHERE THERE IS NOTHING.

You know, the old, "Dragon has been slain", but your team goes towards dragon?

replies.body:
"Dragon has been slain"?

Pfff, you mean the boring ordinary dragon. 

But the real mystical magical dragon is off hiding somewhere just beyond the fog of war. 

You must make with great haste in search for this majestic creature and in due time your wandering and face-checking may perhaps bless you with the smallest glimpse of his magnificent tail and the hairy sack of magic he carries with him.

Try being a support main where even if you keep the entire bot side warded during lane phase ur adc still can't see the enemy coming. Even after you ping 2-3 times they still stay to get that extra 1 minion and inherently die for it.

It's because people have no map awareness. Which means thinking ahead 30 seconds. Where are the enemies likely to be? Where is their VISION likely to be? DO you have vision in the area you want to contest objectives?

If they learnt to do this then OCE would not be a throwing ground like it currently is (even Dire Wolves threw their series vs Chiefs when it was such an easy win from a strategical point of view).
